which implies that $\lim_{n \ensuremath{\rightarrow} \infty} \ensuremath{\mathsf{E}\left[{I_n^{(k)}} \right]} = \lambda_k P_k m_H^{(k)} \int_0^\infty G_k(t) \mu_k(t) dt$.  Using this result, we have
\begin{eqnarray}
\lim_{n \ensuremath{\rightarrow} \infty} \ensuremath{\mathsf{E}\left[{I_n} \right]} &=& \lim_{n \ensuremath{\rightarrow} \infty} \sum_{k=1}^K \ensuremath{\mathsf{E}\left[{I_n^{(k)}} \right]} \nonumber \\
&=& \sum_{k=1}^K \lim_{n \ensuremath{\rightarrow} \infty} \ensuremath{\mathsf{E}\left[{I_n^{(k)}} \right]} \nonumber \\
&=& \sum_{k=1}^K \lambda_k P_k m_H^{(k)} \int_0^\infty G_k(t) \mu_k(t) dt \nonumber \\
&=& \ensuremath{\mathsf{E}\left[{I_{{\ensuremath{\boldsymbol{{\lambda}}}}}} \right]}. \nonumber
\end{eqnarray}
